title: Avocado Labs - Bring your drink, bring your questions: how to get into tech?

metaTags.title: Avocado Labs - Bring your drink, bring your questions: how to get into tech?

description.description: Avocado Labs is a way to keep people connected online and have access to quality content. We will have an hour to discuss the topics that you care about most. All you need to do is bring a drink and your questions to be involved. Everyone is welcome!

heroDescription.heroDescription: Avocado Labs is a way to keep people connected online and have access to quality content. We will have an hour to discuss the topics that you care about most. All you need to do is bring a drink and your questions to be involved. Everyone is welcome!

childMarkdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody: Avocado Labs is a way to keep people connected online and have access to quality content. We will have an hour to discuss the topics that you care about most. All you need to do is bring a drink and your questions to be involved. Everyone is welcome!

overviewSubsections.title: Bring your drink, bring your questions: how to get into tech!

childMarkdownRemark.rawMarkdownBody:
Everyone has their own journey into tech. In this episode, Lawrence Lockhart will share his journey from a Food & Beverage Manager to a Software Developer and the tools he used along the way! 
So, bring your drink and your questions and see you on the 3rd August at 18:00h CEST.

intro.intro: Lawrence Lockhart is a fullstack developer at FedEx, a role that finds him optimizing delivery software for the logistics titan. He’s a graduate of the LaunchCode Bootcamp and currently leads a non-profit dedicated to helping others with their entry into software development roles.  Lawrence credits his daily motivation to his lovely wife Joy and three children, Maalik, Taylor, and Nina.

Ana is a Developer Advocate at Auth0. She has a degree in Fine Arts and a Master in International Business Economics and Management, so she is not your usual software developer. She loves to code and she especially likes Angular. As a very active member of the community, she regularly organises meetups and conferences, like the amazing ngSpain. In Spain, where she’s currently based, she’s an organiser of GDG Vigo and the founder of GalsTech, a group for women in tech from Galicia. Because she is so passionate about diversity, she has also been named a Women Techmaker Ambassador.

James is a developer, speaker, and teacher with a passion for web development, design, and developer tools. He is a Senior Developer Advocate at Auth0 and has over 7 years of experience in Advocacy and Software Development. In his spare time, he runs a YouTube channel, plays co-ed soccer with his wife, spends time with his dogs, and can solve a Rubik’s cube in under two minutes.

description.description: Q&A with Lawrence Lockhart on how to get into tech!
